texts.definition: The goal of trying to hinder other players ability to gain information.
markups: <style="Definition">The goal of trying to hinder other players ability to gain information.</style>

Having as much information as possible about a game state in a game is usually advantageous. <style="CurrentLink">Conceal</style> is the goal of trying to prevent other players from gaining information about part of the game state. While <style="CurrentLink">Conceal</style> goals are often preventing or hindering other players from finding out the location of the specific game elements or the players themselves the aim of <style="CurrentLink">Conceal</style> goals may also be to keep certain information associated with a game element from other players.

The children's game <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Hide-and-Seek">Hide-and-Seek</link></style> is the archetypical example of using <style="CurrentLink">Conceal</style> where all children except one try to Conceal their locations. Another archetypical example is <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Battleships">Battleships</link></style> where players try to place their ships in ways to make it difficult for their opponents to guess where the ships are. An important aspect of the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Stratego">Stratego</link></style> is to keep the identity of one's pieces hiding from one's opponent.

The game <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Zendo">Zendo</link></style> allows the master to secretly make a rule for how differently colored pyramids should be arranged to have "Buddha nature", and the goal of the students is to try and extrapolate the rule from experiments.

Designing <style="CurrentLink">Conceal</style> goals require two parts: providing players with the possibility of hiding and giving them reasons to hide. What is hidden is typically <style="Link"><link="avatars">Avatars</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="characters">Characters</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="game-items">Game Items</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="units">Units</link></style>, or the players themselves.

<style="Link"><link="hiding-places">Hiding Places</link></style> provides possibilities to hide, so this pattern is a basic component that can be used to create <style="CurrentLink">Conceal</style> goals. More generic, the presence of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Asymmetric%20Information">Asymmetric Information</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Imperfect%20Information">Imperfect Information</link></style> in a game can allow <style="CurrentLink">Conceal</style> goals as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Battleships">Battleships</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Stratego">Stratego</link></style> show. <style="Link"><link="red-herrings">Red Herrings</link></style> can help players with <style="CurrentLink">Conceal</style> goals if the players can create these <style="Link"><link="red-herrings">Red Herrings</link></style> as decoys for what they are trying to hide. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Creative%20Control">Creative Control</link></style> can more generally support <style="CurrentLink">Conceal</style> goals through allow players to create additional <style="Link"><link="hiding-places">Hiding Places</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="red-herrings">Red Herrings</link></style>. It can also allow players to make <style="Link"><link="hiding-places">Hiding Places</link></style> better. From an interface perspective, <style="Link"><link="auxiliary-game-screens">Auxiliary Game Screens</link></style> can allow players to perform the actual hiding in ways that are less prone to being seen by other players.

While <style="CurrentLink">Conceal</style> goals can simply be given as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Enforced%20Goals">Enforced Goals</link></style> to players, many combinations of patterns naturally make players take on implicit <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Conceal%20Goals">Conceal Goals</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="enemies">Enemies</link></style>, especially with <style="Link"><link="reconnaissance">Reconnaissance</link></style> goals, is one example. Others are when the game elements, be they <style="Link"><link="avatars">Avatars</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="characters">Characters</link></style>, or <style="Link"><link="units">Units</link></style>, have <style="Link"><link="achilles-heels">Achilles' Heels</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="vulnerabilities">Vulnerabilities</link></style> that others can exploit. The latter of these may make players try to hide some game elements while showing (or sacrificing) others. Players with <style="Link"><link="survive">Survive</link></style> goals are likely to take on <style="CurrentLink">Conceal</style> goals if possible since this offers one solution to completing the <style="Link"><link="survive">Survive</link></style> goals (so <style="CurrentLink">Conceal</style> goals modify the <style="Link"><link="survive">Survive</link></style> goals).

<style="CurrentLink">Conceal</style> goal can be pointless unless somebody is looking for what is hidden; that is, <style="CurrentLink">Conceal</style> goals may only be meaningful if there are <style="Link"><link="preventing-goals">Preventing Goals</link></style>, e.g. <style="Link"><link="gain-information">Gain Information</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="gain-ownership">Gain Ownership</link></style>, that are stopped by the <style="CurrentLink">Conceal</style> goal being successful.

<style="CurrentLink">Conceal</style> is a <style="Link"><link="continuous-goals">Continuous Goal</link></style> which when combined with <style="Link"><link="traverse">Traverse</link></style> provides <style="Link"><link="stealth">Stealth</link></style> goals. When done as (allowed) <style="Link"><link="extra-game-actions">Extra-Game Actions</link></style> they support <style="Link"><link="sanctioned-cheating">Sanctioned Cheating</link></style>. To others, <style="CurrentLink">Conceal</style> goals can be <style="Link"><link="unknown-goals">Unknown Goals</link></style>.
